extendedInfo.description: Assassinate the shogun, then vanish without a trace in this interactive fantasy novel!In the high-stakes game of politics between two feudal lords, you are a ninja village's chosen warrior. Earn glory for your clan as you battle your enemies, becoming a master of magic, combat, and stealth.Will you bring peace to your village, or return home in shame? Will you serve your daimyo obediently, or defy his orders for the greater good? Or will you use your powers of invisibility for personal gain? The choice is yours.

reviews.title: Fairly good
reviews.comment: It does feel short but tells a complete story and is entertaining. Not as bad as the previous reviews made it sound. Some noticeable typos.
reviews.author: Thomas Ling

reviews.title: Poorly written with a boring plot
reviews.comment: One of the worst CoG titles to date. A real shame after the amazing wrestling game they put out.
reviews.author: Benjamin Burchfiel

reviews.comment: I like the cover art, the plot is interesting, I like how we\'re able to use magic, the stats are dynamic, it\'s pretty diverse, and the characters have distinct personalities. But the diction level is only moderate, it can be a little vague at times, there are a couple grammar/spelling errors, it\'s slightly linear and it\'s pretty short with an ending that\'s more abrumpt than a cliff hanger.
reviews.author: Sam Young

reviews.title: Wasted Potential
reviews.comment: The concept is good, well written, and well thought out but the execution leaves a bit to be desired. While its easy to get immersed in the world, you find that the ending is abrupt and there are too few paths explored and relationships unfulfilled. This story had the potential to be one of the best CoG but the author left too much of it unexplored which left me wanting. Still, its a good story but only average because of the execution.
reviews.author: Marquin Watts

reviews.title: Kinda mediocre
reviews.comment: Great idea and was getting good but then a rather rushed and abrupt ending hit like a What? Moment. More accurate score is 3.5 honestly though the quality of the post-free CoG like Choice of Vampire etc that has been released, has been mediocre down to straight poor. Exception would be Choice of Kung Fu, Heros and the Zombie one only as that seemed to be the only 5 from CoG in a long time.
reviews.author: Justin Moua

reviews.title: Terrible. Don\'t buy!
reviews.comment: Every game by COG just gets worse. I\'m a ninja fanatic and even I didn\'t like it. Linear and way too short yet you charge more than you do for your actually good games.
reviews.author: Kimi Czerwinski

reviews.title: Average
reviews.comment: Relatively short.  Could use more depth when it comes to relationships with other characters in the story.  Definitely middle of the road when compared to other choice games.  Could be better.  Could be worse.  I feel that there were some opportunities lost in this story,  but it still has some appeal.
reviews.author: Matt Noggle

reviews.title: Good overall
reviews.comment: It has a lot of depth but too short
reviews.author: Emerson Porter

reviews.title: Very good, where\'s the rest of it?
reviews.comment: It\'s up to the usual high standards we\'ve come to expect, but stops suddenly after less than an hour\'s play. Would have expected this much play from a teaser.
reviews.author: Morgane Guillemot

reviews.title: Not as good as others by Choice of Games
reviews.comment: It was shorter than I was hoping for, and I felt like my choices didn\'t have a strong impact on the story. Each choice seemed only to affect the outcome of that situation, with a few throw away choices where the effects were interrupted by the story on the next page. Overall it felt like a short story with a few minor sidetracks instead of a full Choice Of game. I recommend this publisher, but not this game.
reviews.author: Caed Ookami

reviews.title: Short
reviews.comment: It\'s has a decent story, but felt short or rushed. Fun overall and interesting theme.
reviews.author: Armando Favela
